alert.note: Alert for Hidalgo (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 21 at 10:37PM MDT until August 22 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in New Mexico... Gila River Above Virden affecting Hidalgo County. For the Gila River...including Virden...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is imminent or occurring. * WHERE...Gila River Above Virden. * WHEN...Until Monday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3 am MDT Sunday, the observed stage was 9.66 ft. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 25 ft late Sunday night, and fall below flood stage late Monday afternoon and continue falling to 8 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.0 feet on 12/19/1978. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 600 AM MDT.
